isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE / 9200 9300 9400 MODELS BUILT AFTER JANUARY 1, 1995 - HEHR POWER SYSTEMS/POWERLINE ALTERNATORS USED ON EMERGENCY VEHICLES - TROUBLESHOOTING - FULL FIELDING THE ALTERNATOR

svcproc.title: FULL FIELDING THE ALTERNATOR
svcproc.para:
Insert a small pin into full field access hole (Refer to Figure 3
). Attach a jumper lead, with a 10 amp fuse, from pin to positive post on the alternator. With engine running at 800 to 1000 RPM, alternator output should be 15 to 16 volts. (It will be necessary to push pin in hole to insure contact is made.)

warning.para: If the rotor is shorted to ground, the pin may get hot enough to cause burns.

svcproc.para: If the alternator voltage increases, it is working. Problems might be due to the regulator being bad or connected incorrectly. Double check wiring on rear of alternator for correct hookup before replacing regulator. If the alternator fails to work, the alternator itself is bad and should be diagnosed for repair. It is rarely necessary to replace an alternator.
